title: how about doing the same thing for "immobile mages" that you are doing for "juggernauts"?
body:
i would really like to see something done with immobile mages, specifically {{champion:134}} {{champion:161}}   and  {{champion:143}} 

all three of these champions are pretty damn helpless when jumped on. they do have some self peel in the form of CC or a slow, but for the most part if they get jumped on they WILL NOT be able to escape someone like {{champion:62}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:245}}  and any other mobility monster that wants them dead.

that being said, why do they offer no real power to a team when picked despite these very obvious weaknesses? Syndra/vel/zyra do not offer any more burst over a much safer pick like {{champion:103}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:105}} with the exception of {{champion:143}} , they dont even offer that much more CC either.

despite the negativity {{champion:45}} has received after his rework, i actually think both him and {{champion:1}} are PERFECT examples of what a immobile burst mage should be like.for example, someone like {{champion:245}}  or {{champion:105}} have to be very careful and think about when to go on these two champs because they can be bursted down VERY quickly. they do not have to worry about that when going on someone like syndra/velkoz tho.

So, to make a long story short, why are you guys keeping syndra/vel/zyra weak when everyone else with more cc and utility can do more than them??

Immobile mages definitely need the same treatment as what we're doing for the juggernauts. Not because "buffs" (those can happen at any time), but because they really need true uniqueness from champ to champ. 

If you asked the question "I'm a champ that brings a bunch of aoe spell damage and some CC, who am I?" you could answer Velkoz, Zyra, Syndra, Brand, Cass, Malzahar, and ziggs.  Ideally we could find what makes these champs unique and sharpen it enough so that the reason you would bring those champs to your team isn't just whoever has the highest numbers.

As for the buffs that you're asking for, I'll have to run it by the live balance team and they can better speak to if any of them are in an underpowered state.
ziggs has mobility, also you forgot xerath and lux.

{{champion:50}} The forgotten champion who looks completely out of place for a supposed ruler of Noxus .___.
He might need a bit more than some uniqueness sharpening.

How about {{champion:99}} ? Yes, she got some QoL buffs and her super cute Mahou Shoujo skin, but she keeps getting outpicked by Orianna, Morgana, Xerath and Ziggs, all because anything she can do, they can generally do better.

Maybe an upgrade to her passive that reveals affected enemy Champions (not including stealth)? Or is that too much vision?

_EDIT: Downvoted for asking about Lux? Wow._

Meanwhile {{champion:50}} brings less pressure, less range, weaker poke (considering he needs to be in engage range to utilize nearly 3/4ths of his kit) and overall contributes far less at greater danger to himself.

Seriously, play Swain, and then play Lux, they fill two entirely different Niches, sure, but you'll notice for a 'Master Tactician' Swain plays a hell of a lot more dangerously for far less of a reward.

Also Swain's last skin was in May 2012. People need to stop bitching their Champions need skins because the only ones that need skins more than Swain are being given full reworks in the future (and also {{champion:14}} has no special particle effect skins so...)

I was not asking for a new Lux skin; I was simply asking whether or not Meddler had any thoughts on giving Lux more of a unique niche since she tends to be a "jack-of-all-trades-master-of-none" mage who gets outpicked by other mages/supports. _(And yet I get downvoted to hell for asking...)_

As for Swain, his kit already has some serious power to it, but he's just poor against tanks. It's not just that he has more trouble damaging them; its that his ultimate heals less off tanks with high MR.

If I were to give Swain any changes right now, I'd look at modifying the healing on his ultimate to be flat heals based off enemies hit rather than based off damage dealt (kinda like what happened to Renekton's Q several patches ago). This would normalize Swain's combat sustain against opponents with high MR, making his heal more reliable.

You really think nothing differentiates those champions? As someone else said you have to go just below the surface to differentiate those champions. There are undoubtedly a lot of mages that are lacking in niches but "AOE spell damage and CC" is just... what a mage is. You may as well say "I'm a ranged character who autos lots and has a steroid - who am I?", then say that every single ADC is the exact same champ - while ADCs typically lack in differentation, Sivir is NOT identical to Jinx.

Vel'Koz is... honestly somewhat hard to give a niche to, I'll give you that. He's quite decent against tanks but occasional true damage doesn't make a tank buster, and otherwise he's just a standard poke mage.
Zyra's a zone control mage thanks to her plants and Stranglethorns, she's a DPS mage thanks to her plants, she's a counter-engage mage because her kit is quite strong against divers (I can't think of many other mages who specialise in counter-engaging) and her synergy with Liandry's makes her one of the better anti-tank mages. Lots of things you'd want her for.
Syndra's the premier single target burst mage in the game. If she was usable right now she'd be picked for the ability to snowball the laning phase and assassinate priority targets, in exchange for a poorer teamfight.
Brand I'd consider lacking, though he works well enough with Liandry's to be anti-tank.
Cass had a horrendous rework but has one of the most specific niches in the game as the mage ADC. If you think she's generic then... is there any mage that you think stands out from the pack? She seems anything but generic to me.
Malz = single target mage assassin, pool makes him exceptional against tanks and his suppression makes him really good at making diving the backline as a single threat undesirable. Anti-assassin tank shredding mage.
Ziggs = sieging mage. He is impossible to push against and difficult to defend against.

I absolutely agree that some mages need to be changed so that they stand out from the crowd. "Why pick Vel'Koz when you can pick Xerath or Lux?" is the type of question in the mage class that needs to be answered. But to say that every mage with AOE damage and CC is impossible to distinguish from every other character with that is ridiculous. Would you rework every assassin if I said they all brought high damage and mobility? Probably not.

Don't give every mage in the game a stupid gimmick just because if you describe them in the absolute vaguest of terms, they sound similar. Many mages have a niche - even most of the mages you listed do. You don't need to give Syndra some stupid "does more damage against the enemy's hero" mechanic for her to have a unique reason to be picked.
